oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from James B. Owen to Sarah Bell
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Letter from Pvt. James B. Owen, Co. D, 31st Ill. Inf. Regt., USA to Sarah Bell. He tells her he has seen Mrs. Cogswell, and the Brooks family. He speaks at length to the distances the army has marched. He asks Sally to say hello; to her family and to "little Dorah." He writes that he would have come home sooner but is "afraid of the [guerilles]" Owen was from Brownsville, Ill. and died Sept. 3, 1863.
